# EC016-240660 - Master Planning - CSC Nova Institution

## Tender Information

**Recently Closed Tender**
The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC), acting on behalf of Correctional Service Canada (CSC), issued a request for proposal (RFP) to select a provider for Architectural consulting services related to the development of an institutional master plan for the Nova Institution.

The RFP was a closed, selective proposal process under the Supply Arrangement (SA) E0225-152290 for Architecture Consulting Services. The procurement was conducted in accordance with the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA), Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA), and Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for the Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP).

### Tender Details
* **Publication Date**: September 20, 2023
* **Closing Date**: October 12, 2023
* **Expected Contract Start Date**: October 31, 2023
* **Expected Contract End Date**: September 30, 2027

### Complementary Services
Services were not anticipated from this RFP.

### Geographic Scope
This tender was administered solely in the province of Nova Scotia.

### Soliciting Agencies
The contract was administered by the Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC), in collaboration with the Correctional Service Canada (CSC).

### Selection Criteria
Selection was based on the highest combined rating for technical merit and price.

### Bidding Requirements
Invited firms were Architecture49 Inc, DFS Inc architecture & design, Republic Architecture Inc, and nine other national and international firms.

### Contact Information
For any questions or further information, please contact:

Grant, Stewart (SPAC/PSPC)
Email: [stewart.grant@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:stewart.grant@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
Phone: (Include phone code if necessary)

All prospective bidders must ensure that their questions are addressed in writing to the Government department no later than the specified closing date.

## Debrief Procedure
Debrief may be requested on the results of the bid solicitation. Bidders must request a debrief within fifteen (15) working days from the date of notification if their bid was unsuccessful. Further details are available upon request.
